name: hamartia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a character fault or a mistake that causes someone to fail or be destroyed: Just like Greek tragedy, reality TV plays with hubris and hamartia, with faulty self-images and mistakes that prove catastrophic.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the play, Heracles is a great hero and does many great deeds, but his one flaw, his hamartia, is madness, which makes him kill his family.Hamartia is the name used to describe the fatal flaw that brings about the undoing of the hero in classical Greek tragedy.True Aristotelian hamartia arises when mistakes or errors cause the plot or direction of action to change in a tragic way.This failure to act must lead to a change in fortune for the main character in order for it to truly be a hamartia.
